summary: This is a government letter to Judge Alison J. Nathan opposing Ghislaine Maxwell's request for a subpoena to obtain records from Boies Schiller Flexner LLP. The government argues against subpoenaing Minor Victim-2's entire diary, a pair of boots, and original photographs, stating the requests fail to meet legal standards for relevance, admissibility, and specificity.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case who is seeking to subpoena records from Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, including a victim's diary, boots, and photographs.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case to whom this government letter is addressed, regarding the defendant's subpoena request.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the individual Minor Victim-2 met; the defendant and Epstein allegedly purchased boots for the victim.

persons.name: Minor Victim-2
persons.context: A minor victim whose diary, boots, and photographs are the subject of the subpoena request; she is expected to testify at trial.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney who submitted this letter on behalf of the government.

connections.description: Implied co-conspirators; the letter states the defendant and Epstein purchased boots for Minor Victim-2.
Maxwell is the defendant accused of crimes involving Minor Victim-2, who is a witness/victim in the case.
Epstein is mentioned as the person Minor Victim-2 met; her diary entries relate to him.

events.title: Court Order on Subpoena Request
events.description: The Court issued an order on April 27, 2021, regarding Maxwell's request for a subpoena for records from Boies Schiller Flexner LLP.

events.title: Government's Production of Diary Pages
events.description: The government obtained and produced seven pages of Minor Victim-2's diary to the defense in discovery.

events.title: Trip with Epstein
events.description: Minor Victim-2 took a trip with Jeffrey Epstein, during which she met Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: 40 Foley Square, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The government opposes Ghislaine Maxwell's subpoena for Minor Victim-2's entire teenage diary, arguing it is irrelevant, overbroad, and barred by Rule 17(h).
The government acknowledges Minor Victim-2's diary contains no references to Ghislaine Maxwell, a fact both sides agree on and the victim will testify to.
The government is working to obtain a pair of boots (purchased by Maxwell and Epstein for the victim) via the FBI to make them available to the defense, potentially mooting that request.
The government has already produced copies of the photographs Maxwell seeks and argues her request for the originals lacks justification.
The legal argument centers on the Nixon standard for Rule 17(c) subpoenas, requiring relevancy, admissibility, and specificity, which the government claims Maxwell's requests fail to meet.
